FOUND IN: Rhubarb (in contexts where leaves are discarded)
Etymologist: Specializes in the study of the history and origin of words, tracing their evolution over time.
Gazelle (a fast-running antelope, often associated with speed though not a direct relation to deer)
Magnate (often used for wealthy individuals in various industries)
Silica: Another name for SiO2, which makes up around 50% of quartz by mass.
Shalom Aleichem (to one person: hello, peace be upon you)
Brass (an alloy made of copper and zinc, often used for musical instruments)
